ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Wooho Absor's a Bard!!  Absor's a Bard!!  Absor's a Bard!!! *does a little dance*
ygData.msgSnippet: Well that s not entirely fair. He states that his own test is inconclusive: So, what have I to conclude from my testing? Not a thing. His quote about being a
ygData.messageBody:
Well that's not entirely fair. He states that his own test is inconclusive:
So, what have I to conclude from my testing?
Not a thing.

His quote about being a happy bard is simply stating that he enjoyed a
bard's versatility and usefulness. He never really bring's up John Kim's
statistics that I see. He does talk about some "debate about Bards and
their Lullaby".

Just based on this one article, he doesn't really sound like a very serious
bard.

---Windleaf Mistsong
No longer a member of the falling apart Clan Battlehammer on Bertox :(

At 04:26 PM 10/17/00 -0700, jhenders@... wrote:

>Worse than that, for the whole playerbase, IMO, was his willingness to
>completely throw out the detailed study John Kim had posted (article
>comments indicate that was the thread he had been reading) and instead
>rely on his very brief experience with the song before he got distracted
>helping a player find his corpse. Then he announces he's perfectly happy
>with the song, as if that negates anyone else's concerns. This seems
>little different than Abashi's attitude.
>
>On Tue, Oct 17/00, "Cyr, Thierry" <thierry.cyr@...> wrote:
> > doh, i was hoping he was at least a few levels higher *sigh*
> >
> >
> > Hmm. Check out his other article here. A little less encouraging, I'd
> > say.
> >
> > http://eqx.simplenet.com/Issue140/edita.htm
> >
> > On Tue, Oct 17/00, "Cyr, Thierry" <thierry.cyr@...> wrote:
> > > http://www.eqx.simplenet.com/Issue50/musings.htm
>
>--
> Artificial Intelligence stands no chance against Natural Stupidity.
> GAT d- -p+(--) c++++ l++ u++ t- m--- W--- !v
> b+++ e* s-/+ n-(?) h++ f+g+ w+++ y*
>
>
>
>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
>with the subject submissions.
